hanzi-su-wiki:
襲

Значения

Нападать; наследовать; складывать, накладывать

Мнемоника

Одежда 衣 воина, гладкая, как чешуя дракона 龍 и позволявшая быстро и незаметно подползать к противнику.

Варианты

袭
purpleculture_pinyin:
xí
to attack; to inherit; classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)
нападать; наследовать; классификатор костюмов (особенно погребальных халатов)
rtega_mnemonic:
襲襲RS
袭袭		raid, attack, inherit, succeed
  • RS. to dress 衣 like a dragon 龍/龙: put on ready to attack
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 袭)
Pictophonetic: 衣 indicates the sound; 龍 (dragon) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 襲擊 [ xí jī ]: attack (esp. surprise attack); raid; to attack
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 龍 [ lóng ] dragon; symbol of the emperor
    • 衣 [ yī ] cloth; clothes, apparel; dress, coat
heisig_chinese_memo: Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot snake" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor raided neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment.
heisig_constituent: attack, old dragon, vase, stand up, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, slingshot, catapult, snake, self, three, cloth, clothes, clothing, garment, dragon*
heisig_story: Vase . . . meat . . . slingshot (doubled up with) snake . . . three . . . garment. The top half of this character is the old form for the kanji in frame 575.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: attack, advance on, succeed to, pile, heap
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: атаки, наступление на, удастся, сваи, кучи
koohiiStory1: The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for "dragon". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji "imperial dragon". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a slingshot (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot-snake" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor attacked neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment.
koohiiStory2: You attack an old dragon 龍 and take his clothes. REF: dragon [old] (#2981).
jp_example_words:
襲う(おそう): to attack
襲撃(しゅうげき): attack, charge, raid
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Imperial clothes allow you to perform an ancient attack that cannot be repelled.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: IMPERIAL ATTACK, GO! Imagine what this imperial attack might look like and imagine yourself in some swanky imperial clothes while you perform it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The attack's power is concentrated in the shoes (しゅう) in this imperial outfit. You attack with your feet, kicking the enemy with your old, fancy shoes.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the shoes as you attack, they glow—full of attack power! These +4 attack shoes are really special.
Ru_Meaning: attack, advance on, succeed to, pile, heap
Ru_Words:
襲うおそう
  • нападать, атаковать, делать налёт, обр. нагрянуть (неожиданно посетить), постигать (о несчастье и т. п.)
  • наследовать что-л
    • warodai
    襲撃しゅうげき
  • нападение, налёт, набег, [неожиданная] атака
    • warodai
    襲名しゅうめい
  • наследование чьего-л. [сценического] имени
    • warodai
    逆襲ぎゃくしゅう
  • контратака, вылазка (из крепости)
  • находчивый ответ, парирование
    • warodai
    世襲せしゅう
  • наследственный, родовой
    • warodai
    強襲きょうしゅう
  • штурм, приступ, налёт, форсированная атака
    • warodai
Ru_trainchinese:
xí: (графема) следовать примеру, продолжать как раньше, наследовать; внезапно нападать
xí: (сч.слово) счетное слово для одежды (обычно для костюмов и юбок)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dragon (龍) with clothes (衣) attacks
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When police went on raids long ago, they would wear dragon skin armored clothing.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from one " clothing " to another " clothing ", inscriptions from " clothing ", " sail " sound, similar to the " Suowen "籀text. The original meaning is to wear clothes plus clothes, that is, add clothes to clothes. Xu Shen believes that the original meaning is underwear with the skirt on the left. "Said Wen": "Xi, Zuo 衽 gown. From the clothes, the sound is province. 𧟟, the text is unconscious."

The remnant of the oracle bone inscriptions, the meaning is unknown, see "Collection" 27959.

The inscriptions in gold mean covering and yin blessing, [Dong Ge] Gui: "Eternally attack the body", which means that the ancestors yin bless oneself. "Zuo Zhuan. The twenty-eighth year of Zhaogong": "For this reason, the descendants will receive it."

There are two glyphs on bamboo slips in the Warring States period. One is from the second " clothes ", and the other " clothes " is written inside the other " clothes ", which means to wear clothes plus clothes, and clothes with clothes. "Book of Rites. "Nei Ze": "The cold dare not attack." Zheng Xuan's note: "Strike means heavy clothing." This glyph is extended to meanings such as repetition, overlap, inheritance, and inheritance. The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period indicate that they are inherited and used, "Tsinghua Jane One. "Chu Residence" Jane 10: "The king of Zhuang moved to attack Fanying", which means that the king of Chu Zhuang lived in the old capital city (Fan Ying) because of the invasion of the former king. "Tsinghua Jane II. "The Year of the Year" Jane 110-111: "The Yue King Goujian defeated Wu, and the Yue people were better off following Wu." It means that the Yue King Goujian defeated the Wu State, and the Yue people followed the habits of the Wu State and made good relations with the Jin State. "Tsinghua Jane II. Jane 37-38: "Huai Gong flees from Qin Dynasty. Qin Mu Gong called Wen Gong to Chu to attack Huai Gong's room." It means that Huai Gong escaped from Qin and Qin Mu Gong summoned Wen Gong to Chu. , Accepted the wife of Gong Huai in Qin.

The second type of glyph is from "宀" and "譶" to express unexpected attacks, "Tsinghua Jian Two." "The Year of the Year" Jane 46: "Qin Zhishu sent people back and said: "Since I have the door of Zheng Zhi, I will attack it." Master Qin will attack Zheng from the east." It means that the soldiers of Qin State guarding the frontier sent people back. He told him, "I have obtained the key to Zheng Guo's gate. Let's attack Zheng Guo." Qin Shi will attack Zheng Guo from the east. "Tsinghua Jane II. "The Year" Jane 93-94: "Qizhuang Gong involved in the river and attacked the Song Dynasty to restore the division of yin." It means that Qi Zhuanggong (leading the army) crossed the river on foot to recover the battle of pingyin.

" Hit " used in combat, and more that secret offensive, in order to surprise the enemy. There is still the term "sneak attack" in modern Chinese, which refers to a sudden attack while the enemy is unprepared.

The Chinese seal is used as the name of the person, "Chinese Seal Characters": "Guo Xi".
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from one " clothing " to another " clothing ", the original meaning is to put on clothes plus clothes, that is, clothes on top of clothes; inscriptions from " clothes ", "龖" sound. The extension is overlap, duplication, lineage, inheritance, etc.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從一「衣」在另一「衣」之內，金文從「衣」，「龖」聲，與《說文》籀文形近。本義是穿衣加服，即在衣服上再加衣服。許慎則認為本義是衣襟在左邊的內衣。《說文》：「襲，左衽袍。从衣，龖省聲。𧟟，籒文襲不省。」

　　甲骨文辭殘，意義不詳，參《合集》27959。

　　金文表示覆被、蔭佑，[冬戈]簋：「永襲厥身」，表示祖先蔭佑自身。《左傳．昭公二十八年》：「故襲天祿，子孫受之。」

　　戰國竹簡有兩種字形，一種從二「衣」，一「衣」寫在另一「衣」的裏頭，表示穿衣加服，衣上加衣。《禮記．內則》：「寒不敢襲。」鄭玄注：「襲謂重衣。」這種字形引申為重複、重疊、沿襲、繼承等義。戰國竹簡表示因襲、沿用，《清華簡一．楚居》簡10：「莊王徙襲樊郢」，意謂楚莊王因襲前王，在舊的都城（樊郢）居住下來。《清華簡二．繫年》簡110-111：「越王勾踐克吳，越人因襲吳之與晉爲好。」意謂越王勾踐打敗吳國，越人沿襲吳國的習慣，與晉國交好。《清華簡二．繫年》簡37-38：「懷公自秦逃歸，秦穆公乃召文公於楚，使襲懷公之室。」意謂懷公從秦國逃回來，秦穆公於是召喚文公到楚國，接受懷公在秦國的妻室。

　　第二種字形從「宀」，「譶」聲，用來表示出其不意的進攻，《清華簡二．繫年》簡46：「秦之戍人使人歸告曰：『我既得鄭之門管也，來襲之。』秦師將東襲鄭」，意謂秦國戍守邊疆的士兵派人回來告訴說：「我已得到鄭國大門的鑰匙，來進攻鄭國吧。」秦師將要從東進攻鄭國。《清華簡二．繫年》簡93-94：「齊莊公涉河襲朝歌，以復平陰之師。」意謂齊莊公（帶領軍隊）徒步過河，以收復平陰之戰。

　　「襲」用於作戰，多指秘密的進攻，以期突擊敵軍。現代漢語仍有「偷襲」一詞，指趁敵不備，突然襲擊。

　　漢印用作人名，《漢印文字徵》：「郭襲」。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從一「衣」在另一「衣」之內，本義是穿衣加服，即衣上加衣；金文從「衣」，「龖」聲。引申為重疊、重複、沿襲、繼承等。

襲襲RS
袭袭 		raid, attack, inherit, succeed
  • RS. to dress 衣 like a dragon 龍/龙: put on ready to attack
(Simplified: 袭)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 衣 indicates the sound; 龍 (dragon) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 龍 [ lóng ] dragon; symbol of the emperor

①趁敵人不備時攻擊：襲擊。襲擾。夜襲。偷襲。侵襲。
②觸及：寒氣襲人。“芳菲菲兮襲予”。
③照樣做，照樣繼續下去：因襲。沿襲。世襲。
④量詞，指成套的衣服，衣一襲。
⑤衣上加衣，引申爲重迭：“襲朝服”。“山三襲，陟”。
⑥合，和：“齊秦襲”。

甲骨文從一「 衣 」在另一「 衣 」之內，金文從「 衣 」，「 龖 」聲，與《說文》籀文形近。本義是穿衣加服，即在衣服上再加衣服。許慎則認為本義是衣襟在左邊的內衣。《說文》：「襲，左衽袍。从衣，龖省聲。𧟟，籒文襲不省。」 甲骨文辭殘，意義不詳，參《合集》27959。 金文表示覆被、蔭佑，[冬戈]簋：「永襲厥身」，表示祖先蔭佑自身。《左傳．昭公二十八年》：「故襲天祿，子孫受之。」 戰國竹簡有兩種字形，一種從二「 衣 」，一「 衣 」寫在另一「 衣 」的裏頭，表示穿衣加服，衣上加衣。《禮記．內則》：「寒不敢襲。」鄭玄注：「襲謂重衣。」這種字形引申為重複、重疊、沿襲、繼承等義。戰國竹簡表示因襲、沿用，《清華簡一．楚居》簡10：「莊王徙襲樊郢」，意謂楚莊王因襲前王，在舊的都城（樊郢）居住下來。《清華簡二．繫年》簡110-111：「越王勾踐克吳，越人因襲吳之與晉爲好。」意謂越王勾踐打敗吳國，越人沿襲吳國的習慣，與晉國交好。《清華簡二．繫年》簡37-38：「懷公自秦逃歸，秦穆公乃召文公於楚，使襲懷公之室。」意謂懷公從秦國逃回來，秦穆公於是召喚文公到楚國，接受懷公在秦國的妻室。 第二種字形從「 宀 」，「 譶 」聲，用來表示出其不意的進攻，《清華簡二．繫年》簡46：「秦之戍人使人歸告曰：『我既得鄭之門管也，來襲之。』秦師將東襲鄭」，意謂秦國戍守邊疆的士兵派人回來告訴說：「我已得到鄭國大門的鑰匙，來進攻鄭國吧。」秦師將要從東進攻鄭國。《清華簡二．繫年》簡93-94：「齊莊公涉河襲朝歌，以復平陰之師。」意謂齊莊公（帶領軍隊）徒步過河，以收復平陰之戰。 「 襲 」用於作戰，多指秘密的進攻，以期突擊敵軍。現代漢語仍有「偷襲」一詞，指趁敵不備，突然襲擊。 漢印用作人名，《漢印文字徵》：「郭襲」。

襲字的基本解释

襲
xí
见“袭”。

襲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xí］
［《廣韻》似入切，入緝，邪。］
“袭1”的繁体字。
(1)穿衣加服。古丧礼中称以衣敛尸。
(2)穿衣加服。亦指敛尸之衣。
(3)穿衣加服。衣上加衣。
(4)穿衣加服。亦专指古代盛礼时掩上敞开的外服。
(5)穿衣加服。泛指穿衣，穿戴。
(6)重复；重叠。
(7)引申为堆积，积累。
(8)合，调和。
(9)继承；沿袭。
(10)蒙受；领受。
(11)遮盖；掩藏。
(12)引申指藏物的箱子、包裹等。
(13)出其不意的进攻。
(14)引申为报复。
(15)窃取；抄袭。
(16)进入。
(17)引申为返，还归。
(18)触及；薰染；侵袭。
(19)量词。衣服成套称为袭。
(20)量词。亦单指一件。
(21)量词。重；层。
(22)通“習”。习惯。
(23)通“習”。见“襲襲”。
(24)姓。汉代有袭肃。见《资治通鉴·汉献帝建安十三年》。

襲字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　襲； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页1127第06
〔古文〕㦻?褶【唐韻】【正韻】似入切【集韻】【韻會】席入切，?音習。【玉篇】重衣也。【禮·玉藻】裘之裼也，見美也。服之襲也，充美也。又【樂記】周還裼襲，禮之文也。　又【通鑑】趙烈侯賜公仲連衣二襲。【註】上下皆具曰襲。　又【說文】左袵袍也。　又服也。【司馬相如·上林賦】襲朝服。　又合也。【周語】朕夢協于朕卜，襲于休祥，戎商必克。　又因也。【禮·曲禮】卜筮不相襲。　又重也。【左傳·哀十年】卜不襲吉。　又入也。【晉語】大國道小國襲焉曰服，小國敖大國襲焉曰誅。　又受也。【左傳·昭二十八年】故襲天祿，子孫受之。　又掩其不備也。【左傳·莊二十九年】凡師有鐘鼓曰伐，無曰侵，輕曰襲。　又雜襲，雜沓也。【前漢·蒯通傳】魚鱗雜襲，飄至風起。　又姓。【通志·氏族略】晉有隱士襲元之。【南史】有襲蔿。　【玉篇】籀文作?。【篇海】又作?。

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xí］
["Guangyun" seems to be cut, entertaining, and evil. ]
The traditional characters of "击1".
(1) Dressing and clothing. In ancient funerals, it is said that the body is gathered by clothes.
(2) Dressing and clothing. Also refers to the clothing of the corpse.
(3) Dressing and clothing. Add clothing on top.
(4) Dressing and clothing. It also specifically refers to the outer clothing that was covered and opened during the ancient ceremonies.
(5) Dressing and clothing. Refers to dressing and wearing.
(6) Repetition; overlap.
(7) The extension is accumulation, accumulation.
(8) Combine and reconcile.
(9) Inheritance; inheritance.
(10) To receive; to receive.
(11) Cover; hide.
(12) By extension, it refers to boxes, parcels, etc. of hidden objects.
(13) Unexpected offense.
(14) The extension is revenge.
(15) Steal; Plagiarism.
(16) Enter.
(17) Extended to return, return.
(18) Touching; fumigation; invasion.
(19) Quantifiers. A set of clothes is called an attack.
(20) Quantifiers. Also refers to one piece only.
(21) Quantifiers. Heavy; layer.
(22) Through "Xi". habit.
(23) Through "Xi". See "Strike".
(24) Last name. There was Xisu in the Han Dynasty. See "Thirteen Years of Jian'an by Emperor Xian of the Han Dynasty".

Name meaning

xí
вм. 袭
Radicals: 龍, 衣  (imperial, clothes)
Meaning Mnemonic
Imperial clothes allow you to perform an ancient attack that cannot be repelled.
IMPERIAL ATTACK, GO! Imagine what this imperial attack might look like and imagine yourself in some swanky imperial clothes while you perform it.
Reading Mnemonic
The attack's power is concentrated in the shoes (しゅう) in this imperial outfit. You attack with your feet, kicking the enemy with your old, fancy shoes.
Picture the shoes as you attack, they glow—full of attack power! These +4 attack shoes are really special.
